title: Feature/bodyless putpost
body: The REST Extension can now use PUTs and POSTs without the need of a body

repo.name: ode
repo.description: OpenTOSCA Plan Engine based on Apache ODE

title: ODE-1074:  Change the method name "contains" to "find".
body:
The method tries to find an Object in Collection c that deep equals to the Object t1.
If found, return the found object, otherwise return null.
Thus, rename the method as "find" should be more clear than "contains" since "contains" is prone to ask whether something is contained or not and return true or false.

title: [WIP] Extension Activity improvements
body: This PR is currently work in progress and will provide further improvements of the extension activity support within ODE based on the changes in https://github.com/apache/ode/commit/c927b7905dd2eada281a5e73e37381ea1dcea84f and the initial REST EA bundle.

title: Fix the generation of sha512 hashs
body: This avoid the generation of unnecessary md5/sha1 hashs of the sha512 hash

title: Migration of Extension Activity Support + BPEL REST Extension Bundle
body:
This PR ports the extension activity support from the experimental ODE 2.0 branch to the trunk and provides an initial REST extension activity bundle as an example.

In detail, the following list of changes are applied:
- Integration of extension activity and extension assign operation support from 2.0 branch and later improvements provided in commit 1d5fa185a77c944e8d4a708b451611fa74d5c2dc
- Enhanced object model migration support so that old persisted object models (without extension activity support) can be migrated to the new object model (with extension activity support).
- An inital REST extension bundle with related test cases (in 'bpel-test' project).

title: Upgrade Apache Commons Collections to v3.2.2
body:
Version 3.2.1 has a CVSS 10.0 vulnerability. That is the worst kind of
vulnerability that exists. By merely existing on the classpath, this
library causes the Java serialization parser for the entire JVM process
to go from being a state machine to a turing machine. A turing machine
with an exec() function!

https://web.nvd.nist.gov/view/vuln/detail?vulnId=CVE-2015-8103
https://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-collections/security-reports.html
http://foxglovesecurity.com/2015/11/06/what-do-weblogic-websphere-jboss-jenkins-opennms-and-your-application-have-in-common-this-vulnerability/
